column5: I was up at Roches point and the ice was about 6-7 inches, fluffly snow on top hiding some very slick ice underneath. The perch were small and were biting when the sun was out and when the sun went away so did the perch. I was out in a out 15- 28 feet of water. I was using a glow perch buckshot spoon tipped with Berkley Power maggots. The berkely plastic sure did make a diifference.
No pictures of the beautiful Perch filets cooking over an open fire?
